title: Vegan pea, herb and chickpea burgers
time: Hands-on time 30 min,oven time 10 min, plus chilling
description: Think falafel meets burger and you get these Middle Eastern-inspired vegetarian patties – made with chickpeas, fresh herbs and tahini then served in warm pittas.
ingredients: 3 tbsp extra-virgin olive oil, plus extra for frying
Pittas, rocket, mayonnaise or aïoli and lemon wedges

method.Step 1: Put all the ingredients except the breadcrumbs and flour into a food processor and whizz to a rough paste. Scrape into a mixing bowl, then stir in the breadcrumbs and 10g of the flour. Shape into 4 large patties and chill, covered, for 30 minutes.

method.Step 2: Heat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/ gas 6. Put the remaining flour onto a plate and dip each patty in it to coat. Heat a large glug of oil in a frying pan. When it shimmers, add the patties. Fry for 3-4 minutes on each side until golden, then put in a roasting tin and bake for 10 minutes.

method.Step 3: Serve the burgers in warmed pittas with rocket, mayonnaise or aïoli and a squeeze of lemon.
